meanings.definition: The highest point in the development of something; culmination.
meanings.sent1: The successful launch of the new product marked the apotheoses of our hard work.
meanings.sent2: The construction of the skyscraper represented the apotheoses of modern architecture.
meanings.sent3: Reaching the apotheoses of his video game skills, he finally defeated the final boss.
meanings.sent4: Her graduation day was the apotheoses of her academic journey.
meanings.sent5: The championship game was the apotheoses of the team's season.

meanings.definition: The elevation of someone to divine status; deification.
meanings.sent1: In ancient mythology, the apotheoses of heroes often involved becoming gods.
meanings.sent2: The apotheoses of saints in religious texts are revered by many believers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's constant demand for treats led to its apotheoses in the household hierarchy.
meanings.sent4: The artist's talent was so exceptional that some considered it an apotheoses of human ability.
meanings.sent5: The sudden discovery of the lost city was like an apotheoses in the field of archaeology.
